{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3561475,"name":"Dustin Spicuzza","username":"virtuald","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/virtuald/{size}/65268_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-19T05:34:41.441Z","cooked":"

Bumped to latest WPILib release, and also updated all of the versions for all supported vendors.

A big change here is we upgraded to the latest beta release of pybind11, so none of the updated wheels will be compatible with older wheels. This will resolve some issues we’ve had with MSVC and non-ubuntu Linux platforms. There are some changes to the type stubs as a result of this update, so if you’re using mypy et al then you may notice some breakage.

Please try this out and let us know if there are any issues. As always, general support questions should go in their own thread, but questions specific to this release are welcome here. Thanks!

Upgraded main competition robot last night and ran it through the battery of on and off robot tests. No issues found to report as far as the stack and features we are using (commands-v2, rev, navx, pathplanner, photonlibpy, numpy). (3.1.1 ran super well for us at our week 3 event and we’ll be pushing 3.2.0 hard heading towards our DCMP in week 6).

Thanks for your efforts on quick turnarounds tuned to WPILib updates!

I do have one general question probably related to this release. Per guidance in a GitHub issue thread, we are binding to the roborio specific target that removes OpenBLAS dependency for numpy using "numpy==2.2.1.dev0; platform_machine == 'roborio'" in our TOML. Is this still accurate/correct from a versioning perspective?
